intro: Convallaria ciliata, commonly known as the hairy lily of the valley, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with ciliate margins, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Convallaria ciliata is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
